intro: Scheidweileria ferrata, commonly known as the ironwood plant, is a member of the Bignoniaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. Its wood is hard and dense, earning it the common name "ironwood." The plant is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
